definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: When you go on a journey , it is a good thing to be beforehand with your packing .
sentences.chinese: 当你出门旅行的时候，最好老早把行李包装好。

sentences.english: I should have listened to you. I should have started studying earlier.
sentences.chinese: 我应该老早听你们的，应该早一点开始温习。

sentences.english: Instead it was constructed from parts that did exist way back then.
sentences.chinese: 反之，它是由老早之前确实存在的一些部分构成的。

sentences.english: The word has long since been out of use.
sentences.chinese: 此字老早以前就无人使用了。

sentences.english: Master long ago let their own children to invite neighborhood friends and family.
sentences.chinese: 主人老早便让自家的孩子去请邻里亲朋。

sentences.english: I thought we were done with this topic, Groceries.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这话题我们老早解决了，食品杂货。

sentences.english: I told you before, I don't like anybody who has a bigger mouth than mine .
sentences.chinese: 我老早告诉过你了，我不喜欢有人比我还要大嘴巴。

definition: erhua variant of 壓根|压根[ya4 gen1]
if it were not for/but for
certainly/also written 一準|一准[yi1 zhun3]
contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
(coll.) to be eager for/to long for/to look forward to
